FRAUD INVESTIGATIONS ANALYST WHITNEY LEWIS 
whitney.lewis2121@gmail.com | (301) 741-1081 
 
FINANCIAL LEADERSHIP • COMPLIANCE MANAGEMENT • RISK MITIGATION & OVERSIGHT   
Strategic Fraud Investigations Analyst conducting in-depth investigations into suspected fraud cases, utilizing advanced investigative 
techniques, tools, and databases to gather evidence and build strong cases. Known as a leader, overseeing complex financial data, 
transactional records, and patterns to identify potentially fraudulent activities and develop effective strategies for fraud prevention. 
Collaborate effectively with internal teams, such as Legal, Compliance, and Risk Management, to coordinate efforts and ensure 
compliance with regulatory requirements during investigations, prepare detailed reports and documentation of investigation findings, 
and present clear and concise summaries of evidence and recommended actions. 
LEADERSHIP SKILLS

and present clear and concise summaries of evidence and recommended actions. 
LEADERSHIP SKILLS 
CORE  COMPETENCIES | Financial  Analysis,  Fraud  Detection  and  Investigation,  Risk  Assessment  and  Mitigation,  Investigative 
Techniques, KYC Compliance and Regulatory Knowledge, Evidence Gathering, Collaboration and Communication, Fraud Prevention 
Strategies,  Problem-Solving,  Client  Relations/Support,  Data  Correlation,  Financial  Management,  Waste  &  Abuse  Investigation, 
Leadership, Security Compliance, Money Laundering Detection, Project & Change Management, Data Analytics 
 
TECHNICAL PROFICIENCY | Microsoft Office Suite (e.g., Office 365, Word, Excel, PowerPoint); Splunk, Scan Mobile, Verint, Ensenta, 
UAD, Lexis/Nexis, First Data, Servicemembers Civil Relief Act (SCRA) databases, Teams, Zoom, NICE ActIMIZE, Fusion, Hogan, Compass, 
Fraud Tracker, SAS Case Management

Risk Management & Fraud Analyst, 2022 – 2023 
 
• Detected and prevented fraudulent activity through the thorough analysis of 300-400 suspicious ACH transactions.  
• Employed diligent measures when executing due diligence procedures and promptly initiated corrective actions to mitigate 
any potential losses.  
• Orchestrated comprehensive investigations of both domestic and international financial transactions, strictly adhering to 
global regulatory guidelines and legal requirements. 
• Identified fraudulent patterns, assessed associated risks, and implemented effective measures to mitigate future losses, 
making well-informed decisions based on current fraud trends. 
• Led meetings with management and business partners, fostering collaboration to strategize fraud prevention approaches.

• Trained new employees, developing self-authored training artifacts and standardized documentation to enhance productivity 
and ensure consistency within the team. 
• Delivered informative presentations to senior management, providing valuable insights on fraud analyses, data metrics, and 
risk assessment findings. 
• Offered valuable  recommendations  to  leadership  for  the  development  of  new  fraud  programs  and  enhanced  business 
practices, fortifying security measures.

activities.

other pertinent facts, to support objective conclusions.

WHITNEY LEWIS

• Provided support to the Social Security Administration (SSA) by improving the RCIRP (Re-engineered Comprehensive Integrity 
Review Process) Program and SAS Case Management tool used to conduct case review

• Ensured company adherence to credit policies and procedures for consistent handling of collection matters to maintain strong

• Worked closely with Branch Management to ensure the timely resolution of billing discrepancies.

investigations. 
• Acquired and maintained advanced search and reporting tools and techniques to identify, analyze, and report data.
